page.title: 04MARCHWIEL VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content:
AN INTERVIEW WITH THE VICAR
HE HAS LIVED HERE FOR TEN YEARS AND HE DOES THE GARDENS IN THE CHURCH ONCE A WEEK IN BETWEEN TAKING SERVICES .IN BETWEEN THE SERVICES HE GOES TO WREXHAM TO DO HIS SHOPPING. HE LIKES LIVING IN MARCHWIEL BECAUSE THE PEOPLE ARE FRIENDLY.THE CHURCH IS THE ONLY ONE IN THE AREA SO PEOPLE FROM WREXHAM ALSO COME. ON A SUNDAY THEY HAVE ABOUT ONE HUNDRED PEOPLE GOING TO CHURCH BETWEEN THE FOUR SERVICES.THE NAME OF THE CHURCH IS ST. MARCELLA,ST. DEINIOL. ST. MARCELLA IS THE PATRON ST. OF MUSIC.ST. DEINIOL WAS THE PROPER NAME FOR THE CHURCH. THE BUILDING WAS BUILT IN ABOUT THE SEVENTEENTH CENTURY.THE NAME OF THE VICAR IS TEGID JONES. IN THE VILLAGE THERE ARE ABOUT ONE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED PEOPLE.
